source.cf2c5852:
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.cda48535:
from sklearn.cluster import KMeans
wcss=[]

for i in range(1,11):
  model = KMeans(n_clusters=i)
  model_fit = model.fit(iris_data[['petal_length','petal_width']])
  wcss.append(model_fit.inertia_)

wcss
source.f6694692:
plt.plot(range(1,11),wcss,marker='o',linestyle='dashed',markerfacecolor='red');
plt.xticks(range(1,11))
plt.ylabel('WCSS')
plt.xlabel('Number of Cluster')
plt.show()
source.2a837043:
fg, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10,8))
sns.scatterplot(x='petal_length',y='petal_width',hue='Cluster',data=iris_data,style='Cluster',ax=ax)
sns.scatterplot(x=model.cluster_centers_[:,0],y=model.cluster_centers_[:,1],ax=ax,label='Centroid',s=100)
for i,val in enumerate(model.cluster_centers_):
  ax.annotate(f'Cluster {np.unique(model.labels_)[i]}',(val[0],val[1]))
fg.show()
source.f5f73771: # Finding value of K using Elbow Method
source.2e585496:
# K-Means

K-Means clustering is unsupervised algorithm that uses cluster to predict/classify data points. We have also used elbow method to find optimal value for the number of clusters in below codes.
